channel.title: Rob Wiederstein - a blog about coding, data and public policy
channel.description: Recent content on Rob Wiederstein - a blog about coding, data and public policy

item.title: Motorcycle and Moped Accidents in Florida
item.description: Florida is the destination for many visitors. Many different modes of transportation are available like cars, motorcycles, scooters, mopeds and golf carts. This post explores the accident rate of motorcyles and mopeds.

item.title: Trip to Pictured Rock
item.description: Grand Hotel Mackinac Island Soo Locks Tahquamenon Falls State Park Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore Grand Island Ferry Munising Munising Tourist Park Campground Muldoons for a Cornish “pasty” (It is pronounced “pass-tee”.) Falling Rock Cafe & Bookstore

item.title: Trip to Savannah
item.description: Day 1 – Monday – Sept 13 Arrive Asheville, North Carolina Wilson’s Riverfront RV Park 225 Amboy Road, Asheville, NC 28806 map 1.828.254.4676 (Confirmation: R00000004561) Day 2 – Tuesday – Sept 14 Biltmore Estate $76 beginning admission ticket One Lodge Street Asheville, NC 28803 800.411.3812 Day 3 – Wednesday – Sept 15 Open 6:00 p.m Jettie Rae’s Oyster House 143 Charlotte St Asheville, NC 28801 Reservation made via resy

item.title: Staying Organized in R
item.description: When code starts to run into the dozens of lines, it can begin to look like a jumbled box of legos. The parts all go together, but you can easily forget the order and the ultimate goal of the project. Here’s a post to offer an organizational strategy for writing code in Rstudio.

item.title: Footer for Flexdashboard
item.description: You can create a data dashboard in R using the flexdashboard package. In the background, there are a handful of other packages like bootstrap, bootswatch and fontawesome. The generated website did not have a footer though. Here is a mashup of some html and css. The code was posted in a codepen repo.

item.title: Trip to Key West
item.description: Our trip photos Day 1 – Arrive – July 31 Arrive in Tampa Uber to Lori’s. Ate pizza at Leones. Day 2 – Sunday – August 1 Driving range Go to pool. Shrimp, salad, tater tots for dinner Day 3 – Monday – August 2 Key West Ferry Check in at Bay Suites. Pick up golf cart. Dinner at Thai cuisine. Day 4 – Tuesday – August 3 Drive around

item.title: Indiana Birth Outcomes
item.description: Indiana’s birth outcomes are examined using data from the Annie E. Casey foundation Kids Count website.

item.title: Women Justices - An International Comparison
item.description: Women serving on their country’s highest courts are a relatively new phenomena. The trend accelerated beginning in the 1990s and now includes countries all over the world of differing economic levels. Women impact both the process and outcome of court decisions when appointed. Additionally, women bolster court legitmacy among marginalized and unrepresented constituencies.

item.title: US Lynchings
item.description: 4134 people were killed outside of the judicial process in the United States between 1882 and 1936. Most of the victims were black males living in former slave states of the deep South and were killed by lynching. However, lynchings were not unique to the South and occurred in other places as well.

item.title: Tidymodel Tutorials As Scripts
item.description: This post is a distillation of the tidymodels tutorials on machine learning. Formatting from the original was shortened and converted to a script with comments. Original tutorials are here. This post is basically my notes from the those tutorials.

item.title: 2020 Law School Attrition Rates Part 2
item.description: This post is part 2 of the law student attrition numbers at ABA-accredited law schools. It attempts to separate the law schools into clusters using principal component analysis, k-means, pam, and hierarchical algorithms.

item.title: 2020 Law School Attrition Rates Part 1
item.description: This post explores the law student attrition numbers at ABA accredited law schools in the United States.

item.title: Piping R Code with Magrittr
item.description: I’ve been piping code with dplyr for several years now. But because I use it so often, I thought it was time for a refresher and some renewed investigation. Sometimes, revisiting a topic can help break me out of a programming funk. And sure enough, some new methods were discovered.

item.title: A First Predictive Shiny App
item.description: This shiny app takes the speed in miles per hour of a car and estimates the distance in feet to stop, using data from the 1920s.

item.title: Commercial Fish Production in the Great Lakes
item.description: The Great Lakes Fishery Commission (GLFC) published data on the commercial fish catch in the Great Lakes from 1867 to 2015. Each lake is unique and its features impact what fish are present, their composition over time and the overall volume of commercial fish catch.

item.title: US Post Offices in Kentucky
item.description: Data can yield new insights and enrich our understanding of history. A new book by historian Cameron Blevins takes the location of U.S. post offices from 1639 to 2000 and plots them on a map by date of their establishment. The visual display shows the expansion of the American colonies westward.

item.title: Convert List of Unequal Length to Dataframe
item.description: Lists as a data type can be confusing but also useful. They can hold data of different types and lengths, making them very versatile. Lists can be named or nested and have the same or different lengths. This post deals with converting a list to a dataframe when it has unequal lengths.

item.title: US Immigration Policies in the Trump Administration
item.description: This post presents a timeline of US immigration policy from the Immigration Policy Tracking Project and Professor Lucas Guttentag.

item.title: Animal Ageing and Longevity
item.description: This post uses a data set on animal ageing and longevity. It is compiled and maintained by the Human Ageing and Genomics Resources (“HAGR”) and is located at the senescence.info website website.

item.title: Lost Cargo in Wisconsin Shipwrecks
item.description: The Wisconsin Historical Society created a database of shipwrecks in its waters. The shipwrecks occurred between the years 1679 and 1981. The total number of observations with location data was 615. A text field was included describing the cargo of the ships. A wordcloud of the most frequently used words is created from the text field.

item.title: Shipwrecks of Wisconsin
item.description: hello

item.title: Butterscotch Apples
item.description: A fluffy, light and sweet taste is the result of the apples and butterscotch pudding. It makes for a light dessert option and great dish to take to a gathering.

item.title: Olive Tapenade with Penne
item.description: Growing up, my parents used to always let me have the olive out of their martini. Those halcyon days of yore left me yearning for some olives. If you’re looking to break out of a dull meal selection, this is a wonderful choice. Castelvetrano and kalamata olives with zesty capers, lemon juice and garlic are a feast.

item.title: Navigational Aid Characteristics in the Great Lakes
item.description: There is a wide variety of navigational aids and they are classified according to an international system.

item.title: Lighthouses of the Great Lakes
item.description: This post uses the United States Coast Guard data to plot navigation aides. Many observations were dropped for incomplete data, but those with a dwelling were colored differently. Buoys were omitted too.

item.title: My Hugo Archetype for R Blogdown
item.description: An archetype is a model to follow in drafting a post. A number of other synomyms also come to mind like form, template, outline, scaffold or layout. An archetype is a model kept within the archetypes folder in hugo. It’s a smart way to bring consistency to your posts. Below is the archetype I use in rending an R analysis.

item.title: How to Convert XML to Dataframe Using Xlm2
item.description: Everytime I run into a file with an .xml extension, I cringe. Though, admittedly, it’s a file format that you have to be familiar with when it comes to sending and receiving data over the web. R has a package xlm2 to assist in the conversion of nested data to tabular data.

item.title: Pumpkin Pudding
item.description: I absolutely love pumpkin, but it’s a little boring by itself. This recipe has fewer calories than either pumpkin pie or pumpkin bread. Usually, fall is the perfect time for this but we eat it all year round.

item.title: Twice Baked Spaghetti
item.description: My family usuall groans when this dish is served because it is delicious, but really high in calories.

item.title: Brussel Sprout Hash with Eggs
item.description: This is a meal for any time of day. The yellow yolks contrast from the bright green brussel sprouts and a dash of cayenne pepper give it a culinary kick. This was the specialty of one of our favorite local restaurants.

item.title: Greek Pasta Salad
item.description: This Greek pasta salad is a favorite of my daughter’s with the poignant banana pepper rings. It keeps well in the refriderator and we snack on it all week usually.

item.title: Trip to Ludington
item.description: Our trip photos Day 1 – Arrive – June 7 Ponchos Pond 5335 W. Wallace Ln. Ludington, MI 49431 map 888.308.6602 (7 hr, 50 min.) After setup, ice cream at House of Flavors 402 W Ludington Ave Ludington, MI 49431 map 231.845.5785 Day 2 – Big Sable Point Light House Ludington State Park - 8800 W. M-116 Ludington, Michigan 49431 map 231.845.7343 Two mile walk. Gift shop. Day 3 – Walk to Lighthouse in Stearns Park Stearns Park map

item.title: Drunken Raisins
item.description: In a New York Times article, Ms. Lucia DeClerk credit her 105 years of longevity to prayer and gin and raisins. “Eat nine raisins a day after sitting in the fridge for nine days.”

item.title: Five Basic Viniagrettes
item.description: Vinegrettes aren’t hard, but you need some basic ingredients and a little imagination to get started. This post lists a few of my mainstays for salads.

item.title: Tortellini and Butternut Squash
item.description: This vegetarian dish can be made quickly with frozen tortellini and butternut squash.

item.title: Vegetable Medley Soup
item.description: This is called Vegetable Medley Soup because everything is in it, including the kitchen sink. Before going to the grocery store for the week, I clear out the vegetable bin. The wine is for me not the soup.

item.title: HUGO Variables
item.description: Inspecting a hugo website will reveal templates dependent on variables. You have to have an understanding of what variables are available and under what circumstances. Careful reading of hugo documentation is helpful, but here are a few tips.

item.title: Italian Wedding Soup
item.description: This soup is sooo simple and really fills people up.

item.title: Primer on Working with Go Templates
item.description: Knowing a little bit about the go templating language will help you understand the syntax of layout templates in HUGO.

item.title: Aloo Matar (Potato & Peas)
item.description: It is hard to get excited when you are having potatoes and peas. That’s why you should always say you are fixing aloo matar, a classic Indian dish.

item.title: CV
item.description: Presentations: Recollections from 18 Years of Judging (Henderson Rotary Club, Early Learning Ctr., Sept. 29, 2016). The Role of the Constitution, Campaign Finance, and the Presidential Race of 2016 (Henderson Community College, Henderson, Ky., Sept. 21, 2016). Center for Youth Justice and Services: Making Our Community Safer One Kid at a Time (Co-presenter, Alternatives to Detention Conference, Embassy Suites, Louisville, Ky., Aug. 26, 2016).

item.title: Gallery
item.description: Coming soon.

item.title: Insert HTML Widgets in Blogdown
item.description: Blogdown & Hugo allow for the insertion of html widgets like leaflet. This is a huge time saver because one doesn’t need to learn java and can instead stay within the R environment.

item.title: Datasets
item.description: Airlines & Airports Bureau of Transportation & Statistics. Cruise Ships Sample Cruise Ship Data. Economics Bureau of Economic Analysis. Federal Reserve Economic Data. Aswath Damodaran’s Data Sets. Organization of Economic Cooperation & Development. Education National Center for Education Statistics. Kentucky Department of Education. Kentucky Graduation Project Data. Energy Kentucky Coal Facts. US Energy Information Administration. Global Powerplant Database. General Socrata Open Data Resources.

item.title: Beluga Chili with Tots
item.description: The beluga lentils texture rivals that of ground beef. Definitely, give this recipe a try for your non-vegetarian friends. (Just put a bunch of cheese and hot sauce with it and they’ll never know the difference.)

item.title: Confetti Cornbread
item.description: You do not have to wait to break open a pinata to eat this red and green cornbread. The colors make it a festive treat for any occasion.

item.title: Pistachio Pineapple Salad
item.description: This dish was inspired by my spouse when visiting family as a child. It was sweet, easy to make and all the kids loved it.

item.title: Spinach Breakfast Casserole
item.description: This is a great meal for whenever. I use kale, broccoli, spinach or asparagus depending on what I have on hand. I keep chopped spinach and broccoli in the freezer for this meal.

item.title: Ten Tips to Working with Blogdown
item.description: hello

item.title: Waldorf Salad Redux
item.description: This is a family favorite that, unbelievably, used to be made with mayonnaise. We buy a lot of apples that go uneaten. Toward the end of the week, I often make this to get rid of the leftover apples.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a dad, a retired judge, a guitar player, a former state representative, an amateur programmer and statistician. Out of fear that some may take my posts too seriously, I describe myself as someone who does mostly exploratory analysis and visualization–although I have ventured into predictive analytics and modeling from time to time. I’ve even participated in a couple of kaggle contests and submitted an R notebook. The death of analytical/investigative reporting at the regional and local level is something that concerns me.
